title.narrative: Changing the Game - Peace by Peace

description.narrative: The number of complex intra-state conflicts is on the rise. To meet this challenge joint solutions are needed. CMI is a leading independent conflict resolution organisation with distinctively Finnish added value. Our regional expertise professional methods and relationships developed over 17 years building on the legacy of president Martti Ahtisaari enable us to complement official peace efforts effectively and flexibly. We make good use of our Finnish and Nordic value base of transparency pragmatism and fa irness to build trusted relations and direct access to parties in various conflicts.Sustainable development needs peace justice and strong institutions as indicated in the Agenda 2030. The overall objective of the programme is to prevent and resolve violen t political conflicts broken down into three outcomes: To improve the quality and effectiveness of peace processes To enhance the resilient agency of parties relevant for conflict prevention and resolution To strengthen the international practice in confli ct prevention and resolutionThe programme covers Africa Middle East and Eurasia with five focus areas. 1) Through mediation and dialogue CMI convenes conflict parties to prepare advance and implement peace processes. 2) Through mediation support we can dep loy expert teams flexibly rapidly and cost-effectively based on the mediators needs. 3) CMI supports national actors in the implementation and design of processes which address conflict or its prevention by providing advice on inclusion mechanisms dialogue facilitation methodologies and by bridging stakeholders. 4) CMI is committed to increasing womens participation in peacemaking gearing for action around UN Resolution 1325. Engaging wider society in peace processes significantly increases their legitimacy and sustainability. 5) Learning and sharing is particularly important for the peacebuilding sector where the relationship between norms and best practices merits more attention to help understand what really works. We need closer cooperation with the inte rnational peacemaking community and innovative approaches to develop the field.
